did.abstract: Editor of the Ann Arbor News, 1954-1976. Personal and professional correspondence, photographs, editorials, editorial topical files, and speeches; also organizational files relating to the Booth Newspaper chain and the Ann Arbor News, and to other professional, civic, and charitable organizations, notably the Michigan Press Association, the University Press Club of Michigan, and the Ann Arbor Chamber of Commerce.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

did.physloc: Portions located in offsite storage; prior notification required for access.

acqinfo.p: The bulk of the collection was the gift of Arthur Gallagher (donor no. 6281) and came to the library in 1979.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Arthur Gallagher Papers , Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Arthur Gallagher was born in Manistique, Michigan on May 16, 1911. While a high school student Gallagher covered school sporting events for the local paper, the South Haven Daily Tribune, during the school term and did general reporting during the summer. He became a full time employee following graduation, remaining with the paper for two years working as a reporter, sports editor, and circulation manager. In 1931 Gallagher moved to Ann Arbor where he enrolled at The University of Michigan and began working for The Ann Arbor Tribune. He attended the University until 1935 when he dropped out to go to work at the Tribune on a full time basis. He completed his studies through the University's extension program. Finally in 1976, he received his Bachelor of Arts degree.

At the Tribune, Gallagher worked as a reporter, circulation manager, and editor-manager. In 1937 Gallagher moved to the Ann Arbor News, which was a subsidiary of Booth Newspapers, Inc., where he worked at various times as the county, telegraph, and news editor.
Gallagher replaced Ralph N. Byers as editor of the News after Byers untimely death on August 10, 1954. Gallagher remained editor until his retirement on June 1, 1976.

scopecontent.p: Much of the material contained in the Gallagher papers pertains either to the news and editorial operations of the Ann Arbor News or to the management and business of running the newspaper. The collection has been arranged into the following series: Ann Arbor News general correspondence and memoranda; Editorials and Editorial Subject files; Articles and Speeches; Organizational files; Miscellaneous Topical Files; and Miscellaneous.

did.unittitle: Ann Arbor News general correspondence and memoranda

scopecontent.p: The Ann Arbor News general correspondence and memoranda series contains reader correspondence commenting on local happenings and on the content and format of the News. This series also includes inter-office memoranda and miscellaneous correspondence.
The Editorials and Editorial Subject files includes some of the newsman's editorials as well as additional relevant material such as correspondence, source material, and memoranda filed by subject.

did.unittitle: Performance of Ann Arbor News in reporting political news

scopecontent.p: The Articles and Speeches series contains a few articles as well as copies of a number of speeches delivered by Gallagher between 1959 and 1979, many of which deal with topics related to journalism. Included with Gallagher's works are transcripts of two of three interviews conducted by a University of Michigan student with Gallagher in 1978 as part of an oral history assignment. The paper which resulted from this assignment is also present. The interviews and paper focus on Gallagher's role as editor of the News, but also include valuable biographical information.

did.unittitle: "School Role of the Layman," printed in A Report On The Little White House Conference, December 8, 1956

odd.p: (includes notes, correspondence and source material from series of articles)

did.unittitle: "A Catholic Editor and the Press," Winter 1964
Challenges in Reporting Sensitive Stories May 9, 1966
The Need for a Local Historical Museum May 15, 1967
"The Role of the Press in Creating Public Awareness about Critical Community Problems," circa 1968
Review of Gallagher's Career at Ann Arbor News 1975
Paper, title unknown, on Arthur Gallagher, written in 1978 by University of Michigan student Judy Rakowsky

scopecontent.p: The Organizational files series has been arranged alphabetically by the name of the organization. In addition to Booth Newspapers and the Ann Arbor News many professional and civic organizations are represented. These reflect Gallagher's interest in education, the establishment of professional standards in journalism, and civic affairs. Included among the organizations with which Gallagher was involved are the Inland Daily Press Association, the Michigan Associated Press Editorial Association, the American Red Cross, the Michigan Press Association, and the University Press Club of Michigan.

scopecontent.p: Photographs, many of them probably from the Ann Arbor News, include views of Ann Arbor, Michigan, historic homes and public occasions; also photographs detailing Gallagher's other interests, notably the Lion's Club Eye Bank program.

did.unittitle: Lectures given in retirement to the Dunworkin Club 1980-1992
